item.title: Diverted Roads Very Slippery, 5th January
item.description:
With Chelsfield Road being closed by SGN, Northfield Avenue and Kynaston Road need to be gritted as these are being used for the alternative route. There are currently slippery patches near to parked cars which need to be gritted
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northfield Avenue, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unused/unneeded pole, 5th January
item.description:
There is a grey coloured post approx 2 metres in height sticking out of the pavement at this location. I believe it used to display a directional sign to a nearby car park but there has not been anything attached to it for a while now. If it has no further use maybe it should be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eden Park Avenue, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Solid ice in section between the ltn bollards skid risk to cyclists and pedestrians, 5th January
item.description:
Solid sheet of ice across this section. I nearly rode into it and would have skid off. So much ice makes me think this may be someone deliberately pouring water to make it freeze. Need gritting. Also considerable sheet of ice further up near Bounds Green Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Truro Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not working, 5th January
item.description:
The street light on the left going into Camden Grove, next the the garden of house number 19 is still not working despite being reported some time ago. The area is extremely dark and this presents a security issue now, especially as we have a prowler in the street in the early hours of the morning (reported to police). It also makes it impossible to see the black ice on the street and pavement, so someone could well get injured.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camden Grove, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement inaccesible due to water leak in road causing dangerous ice hazard, 5th January
item.description:
The pavement is inaccesible and dangerous where ice has formed resulting from a water leak in the road. It is currently a 15 foot sheet of pure ice ans the road is full of water. It is right where people get off at the bus stop.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Cypress Road, South Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
